# activate()

**Instance Method**

Activates the receiver app, if appropriate.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func activate()
```

## Discussion

Use this method to request app activation; calling this method doesn’t guarantee app activation. For cooperative activation, the other app should call [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/yieldActivation(to:)] or equivalent before the target app invokes [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/activate()].

Invoking [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSApplication/activate()] on an already-active application cancels any pending activation yields by the receiver.

## Activating and deactivating the app

- **Passing control from one app to another with cooperative activation**: Request focus for your app, and coordinate passing control from one app to another.
- **deactivate()**: Deactivates the receiver.
- **isActive**: A Boolean value indicating whether this is the active app.
- **yieldActivation(to:)**: Explicitly allows another app to make itself active.
- **yieldActivation(toApplicationWithBundleIdentifier:)**: Explicitly allows another app to make itself active.
- **NSApplication.ActivationOptions**: The following flags are for [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSRunningApplication/activate(options:)].
